Activity: Arrive at the office, brew a cup of coffee, and settle in for the day. Check emails and company announcements, but mostly just skim them.

Since the meeting minutes didn't mention any specific goals for me this week, I'll take some time to brainstorm potential areas I can contribute to. Maybe I can start fleshing out some character backstories.

Open my favorite writing software and start brainstorming character concepts. Think about different archetypes and how they might fit into a third-person shooter setting. Light a scented candle to set the mood.
Begin drafting a short backstory for a potential character. Focus on creating a compelling hook and a unique voice. Maybe someone with a dark past and a dry sense of humor.
Take a break and browse some art websites like ArtStation for inspiration. Look for character designs and environments that resonate with the tone I'm aiming for.
Lunch break. Head out to my favorite sandwich shop down the street. Enjoy the fresh air and people-watching.
Continue working on the character backstory. Focus on developing their motivations and relationships with other characters in the world.

Realize I might be working in a vacuum. Send an email to @Ldes-1 and @Sdes-1, @3dmod-1 asking if they have any specific character needs or lore questions that I could address. Topic: Character Backstory Development - Input Request
While waiting for a response, start outlining different factions or groups within the game world. Think about their goals, ideologies, and how they interact with each other.
Wrap up the day by organizing my notes and backing up my work. Read the first few chapters of the novel I am currently reading.
